question: Who lived down by the iron forge?
answer1: a poor widow woman

question: Where did the old woman live?
answer1: down by the iron forge near Enniscorthy

question: What did the old woman do to warm her son?
answer1: fixed him in the ash-hole, near the fire, and piled the warm ashes about him

question: What did the old woman get by book or by crook?
answer1: a goat-skin

question: How did the son feel when he fastened the goat-skin around his waist?
answer1: grand

question: Why did the woman tell her son to take the rope and bring a bresna?
answer1: He never done any good yet.

question: Who came up to Tom?
answer1: a big joiant

question: What happened after Tom saw the joiant?
answer1: Tom jumped a-one side and picked up a ram-pike.

question: What will the giant do if Tom spares his life?
answer1: He'll give him that club.

question: What will the club do as long as Tom keeps from sin?
answer1: He'll win every battle he ever fights with it.

question: What happened after Tom got the club in his hands?
answer1: He sat down on the bresna and gave it a tap with the kippeen.

question: Where did the Bresna take Tom?
answer1: the widow's door

question: What happened after the sticks were all burned?
answer1: Tom was sent off again to pick more.

question: Who did Tom have to fight with this time?
answer1: a giant with two heads on him

question: What did the giant say he would give Tom?
answer1: a fife that nobody could help dancing when he was playing it

question: What did Tom make the giant do?
answer1: dance home, with himself sitting on it

question: Who was the next giant?
answer1: a beautiful boy with three heads on him

question: Why did the next giant give Tom a bottle of green ointment?
answer1: He had neither prayers nor catechism no more nor the others.

question: What did the green ointment do?
answer1: wouldn't let Tom be burned, nor scalded, nor wounded

question: Why did Tom stop walking down street in the heel of the evening?
answer1: Some of the little boys had no more manners nor if they were Dublin jackeens, and put out their tongues at Tom's club and Tom's goat-skin.

question: How did Tom feel after defeating the giants?
answer1: proud

question: What was proclaimed about the King of Dublin's daughter?
answer1: The King of Dublin's daughter was so melancholy that she didn't give a laugh for seven years.

question: How did the King of Dublin's daughter feel?
answer1: melancholy

question: Why didn't the King of Dublin's daughter laugh for seven years?
answer1: She was so melancholy.

question: What did the King promise to whoever would make her laugh three times?
answer1: grant her in marriage

question: What happened after Tom kissed his mother?
answer1: curled his club at the little boys, and he set off along the yalla highroad to the town of Dublin

question: What did the guards do instead of letting Tom through?
answer1: laughed and cursed at him

question: Why did the guards begin to beg for Tom to stay his hands?
answer1: A tap from Tom's club sent them headlong into the moat or down on the stones.
answer2: Tom did nothing but take the fellow by the scruff of his neck and the waistband of his corduroys and fling him into the canal.

question: What did one of the guards do?
answer1: drove his bagnet half an inch or so into his side

question: Who was in the palace yard?
answer1: the King and Queen

question: Where was the princess?
answer1: in a gallery

question: Why were there wrestling and rinka-fadhas?
answer1: to please the princess

question: Why did the young giant have long black hair and a short curly beard?
answer1: His poor mother couldn't afford to buy razhurs.

question: Who wished to marry the princess?
answer1: an envious wizened

question: What was Tom's business?
answer1: make the beautiful princess laugh three times

question: What did the red-headed fellow say Tom wanted?
answer1: to make hares of the king's best men

question: What happened after the princess saw Tom fight the men?
answer1: The princess was so amused that she let a great sweet laugh out of her that was heard all over the yard.

question: How did the king feel when Tom made the princess laugh?
answer1: glad
answer2: sorry

question: What happened after Tom said he quartered of the princess?
answer1: There was no more fighting that day, and Tom was invited to dine with the royal family.

question: What did Redhead say the wolf used to do?
answer1: used to be serenading (sauntering) about the walls, and eating people and cattle

question: What will the Redhead send to show Tom where the wolf lives?
answer1: a jackeen

question: How did the princess feel about Tom?
answer1: not well pleased

question: Why did the princess feel not well pleased?
answer1: Tom looked a different person with fine clothes and a nice green birredh over his long, curly hair; and besides, he'd got one laugh out of her.

question: Where was the wolf walking?
answer1: in the palace yard

question: Where were the King, Queen, and princess safe?
answer1: up in their gallery

question: Who was Gilla na Chreck an Gour?
answer1: Tom

question: What will happen when Gilla na Chreck an Gour gets rid of the wolf?
answer1: He must have all the king's daughter.

question: What did Tom do after he pulled out his flute?
answer1: He began to play like vengeance.

question: What was the wolf obliged to do?
answer1: get on his hind legs and dance Tatther Jack Walsh along with the rest.

question: Who was shut out along with the rest?
answer1: Redhead

question: Who had his eyes on Redhead?
answer1: the wolf

question: Who did the wolf keep his eyes on?
answer1: Redhead
answer2: Tom

question: Why did the wolf keep his eyes on Tom?
answer1: to see if Tom would give him leave to eat him

question: Why was the wolf roaring?
answer1: He was ready to drop out of his standing from fair tiresomeness.

question: Why did the princess give another great laugh?
answer1: There was no fear of anyone being kilt.
answer2: She was so divarted by the stew that Redhead was in.

question: What did the king order Tom to do?
answer1: put away that divel of a wolf

question: Where did Tom tell the wolf to go?
answer1: mountains

question: What did Tom do after he told the wolf to go back to the mountains?
answer1: He said no more, but spit in his fist, and gave a flourish of his club.

question: Who did not laugh during dinner?
answer1: the foxy fellow

question: What did Redhead nudge Tom about?
answer1: how shabby it would look to reneague the adventure

question: Where did many bad women live?
answer1: through a street

question: What did Tom do before he knocked at the gates?
answer1: rubbed himself over with the greenish ointment

question: What happened after Tom knocked at the gates?
answer1: a hundred little imps popped their heads out through the bars, and axed him what he wanted

question: Who did Tom want to speak to?
answer1: the big divel of all

question: What was Tom's business with the Ould Boy?
answer1: the loan of that flail that he saw hanging on the collar-beam for the King of Dublin to give a thrashing to the Danes.

question: Why didn't the Ould Boy refuse Tom's request?
answer1: Tom walked so far.

question: What did the young devil do while some were barring the gates?
answer1: climbed up and took down the iron flail that had the handstaff and booltheen both made out of red-hot iron

question: What did the little vagabond think about?
answer1: how it would burn the hands off of Tom

question: What happened after one fellow tried to seize the flail?
answer1: Tom gave him such a welt of it on the side of his head that he broke off one of his horns, and made him roar like a divel as he was.

question: Why was there such running and racing at home?
answer1: to see Tom and the flail

question: What did Tom bade no one to do?
answer1: touch the fiail

question: What happened after Tom told his story?
answer1: He laid down the flail on the stone steps, and bid no one for their lives to touch it.

question: Why did Redhead touch the flail?
answer1: to make an end of Tom

question: What happened after Redhead's fingers hardly touched the flail?
answer1: He let a roar out of him as if heaven and earth were coming together, and kept flinging his arms about and dancing that it was pitiful to look at him.

question: Why did everyone laugh?
answer1: The poor fellow, between the pain that was only just gone, and the comfort he was in, had the comicalest face that ever you see.

question: What did the princess do after she laughed?
answer1: She came over to Gilla and put her two delicate hands into Tom's two rough ones.

question: What did the early risers find the next morning?
answer1: two long clefts in the stone where it was

question: How did the Danes feel when they heard the story of the flail?
answer1: frightened

question: Why did the Danes' ship sail away?
answer1: They heard of the flail coming into Dublin.

question: Who taught Gilla the "principles of politeness?"
answer1: Pat Mara of Tomenine

question: Why did the widow call her son a thief?
answer1: He didn't do any good at six-feet and over nineteen years.
answer2: He was lazy.
answer3: He did not help his mother.

question: Why did Tom spare the joiant?
answer1: He wanted the club.
answer2: The joiant asked Tom to spare his life.
answer3: The joiant promised to give him the club in exchange for his life.

question: How will the joiant feel when Tom spares him?
answer1: thankful
answer2: relieved
answer3: content

question: Why could Tom gather sticks without giants or fairy men coming to disturb him?
answer1: There were no more giants.
answer2: The beautiful boy with three heads was the last giant.
answer3: Tom defeated all of the giants.

question: Why did Tom set off to Dublin?
answer1: He wanted to make the King of Dublin's daughter laugh.
answer2: He wanted the King of Dublin's daughter's hand in marriage.

question: What will Tom do when he goes to Dublin?
answer1: try to make the King of Dublin's daughter laugh
answer2: look for the King of Dublin's daughter
answer3: visit the King of Dublin's castle

question: Why did the princess not smile when she was in the gallery?
answer1: Nothing amused her.
answer2: She did not find anything interesting.
answer3: She was bored.

question: Why did the guards laugh at Tom instead of letting him through?
answer1: Tom looked funny.
answer2: They did not think Tom could make the princess laugh.
answer3: They could not believe Tom wanted to make the princess laugh.

question: How will the guards feel when Tom attacks them?
answer1: scared
answer2: afraid
answer3: intimidated

question: Why didn't the wizend like Tom?
answer1: The princess looked fondly at Tom.
answer2: The wizend wanted to marry the princess.
answer3: The wizend had to compete with Tom.

question: Why did the fellows gather around Tom?
answer1: They wanted to fight Tom.
answer2: They did not want Tom to make the princess laugh.
answer3: They did not like Tom.

question: Why didn't the king know if he should be glad or sorry?
answer1: Someone finally made the princess laugh.
answer2: Tom won the challenge.
answer3: He was afraid of Tom.

question: What will the king do after Tom makes the princess laugh?
answer1: make Tom his son-in-law
answer2: allow Tom to marry his daughter
answer3: invite Tom to dine with the royal family

question: Why did everyone dance?
answer1: Tom was playing the flute.
answer2: No one could help dancing when the fife was played.
answer3: The music was joyful to dance to.

question: How will the wolf feel dancing for so long?
answer1: tired
answer2: unhappy
answer3: exhausted

question: Why was the wolf never seen in Dublin again?
answer1: Tom gave him a warning.
answer2: He did not want to be hurt by Tom.

question: Why did Redhead put so many challenges against Tom?
answer1: to get rid of Tom
answer2: so he could have a chance with the princess
answer3: so that Tom would not make the princess laugh

question: Why did the princess rather never be Tom's wife than to see him in danger?
answer1: She did not want Tom to fight the Danes.
answer2: She did not want Tom to get hurt.
answer3: She feared Tom would die.

question: How will Redhead feel when he sees Tom succeed in every challenge?
answer1: jealous
answer2: envious
answer3: angry

question: Why did Tom have to go to Hell to get the flail?
answer1: Redhead directed Tom there.
answer2: The flail was powerful.
answer3: Tom had to get rid of the Danes.

question: Why did the Ould Boy wink at the young imp?
answer1: He wanted the imp to trick Tom.
answer2: He wanted to do harm to Tom.
answer3: He wanted the imp to find a way to hurt Tom.

question: Why did the ould thief let Tom go?
answer1: Tom defeated his men.
answer2: Tom was powerful with the flail.
answer3: He did not want to make trouble with Tom.

question: What will the Ould Boy do when Tom gets the flail?
answer1: trick Tom
answer2: order the imps to attack Tom

question: Why did the princess put her hands into Tom's hands?
answer1: He made her laugh three times.
answer2: She loved him.
answer3: He won the challenge.

question: Why would Tom not bring the flail to the palace?
answer1: It was powerful.
answer2: It was to be used against the Danes.
answer3: Only he could touch it.

question: Why didn't anyone go near the flail?
answer1: Nobody wanted to be hurt like Redhead.
answer2: It was dangerous to use.
answer3: Only Tom could touch it.
